meanings.definition: A thing that follows something else.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the sequents were the adventures that came after the main quest.
meanings.sent2: The sequents of the movie were the scenes that followed the climax.
meanings.sent3: The sequents of the recipe were the steps that came after mixing the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The sequents of the game were the levels that followed the tutorial.
meanings.sent5: The sequents of the song were the verses that came after the chorus.

meanings.sent1: The sequents of skipping class were detention and missed lessons.
meanings.sent2: His lie had serious sequents, leading to trust issues with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The sequents of eating too much candy were a stomach ache and regret.
meanings.sent4: The sequents of procrastination were stress and rushed work.
meanings.sent5: The sequents of not studying for the test were a low grade and disappointment.
